column3: (literary) at night, ترا من چشم در راهم. شباهنگام،‎, که می‌گیرند در شاخِ «تلاجن» سایه‌ها رنگِ سیاهی, وزآن دلخستگانت راست اندوهی فراهم, شباهنگام. در آن دم که بر جا دره‌ها چون مرده ماران خفتگانند, در آن نوبت که بندد دستِ نیلوفر به پایِ سروِ کوهی دام, گَرَم یاد آوری یا نه, من از یادت نمی‌کاهم, ترا من چشم در راهم.‎, ―Nima Yooshij

(formal) still, as yet, تازه‌ترین دور نظرسنجی در ایالت‌های حساس نشان می‌دهد که هنوز رقابت در تعداد کافی از این ایالت‌ها آنقدر نزدیک هست که آقای ترامپ همچنان شانس پیروزی داشته باشد.‎, Tâzetarin dowr-e nazarsanji dar eyâlethâ-ye hassâs nešân midahad ke hanuz reqâbat dar te'dâd-e kâfi az in eyâlethâ ânqadr nazdik hast ke Âqâ-ye Trâmp hamčenân šâns-e piruzi dâšte bâšad., The latest round of opinion polls in key states shows that in a sufficient number of them the competition is as yet so close that Mr. [Donald] Trump still has a chance to win.
still, yet, هنوز آماده نیستم.‎, hanuz âmâde nistam., I'm not ready yet.

fame, renown, Synonym of آواز‎(rare) swamp, 10th century. Ḥudūd-ul-ʿĀlam, آب‌هایی که آن را بطیحه خوانند بسیار است ولیکن آنچه معروف است نُه بطیحه است ... و هفتم بطیحه بخارا، آن را آوازه بیکند خوانند، اندر بیابان است.‎, āb-hāē ki ān rā baṭīḥa xwānand bisyār ast walīkan ānča maʾrūf ast nuh baṭīḥa ast ... wa haftum baṭīḥa-i Buxārā, ān rā Āwāza-i Baykand xwānand, andar bēābān ast., There are a lot of waters which are called swamps, but those which are [the most] famous are nine ... and the seventh—the swamp of Bukhara, it is known as Āwāza of Baykand, [it] is in desert., (rare) pool, 11th century. elixirrare, 1959, Behbahani, National Consultative Assembly, 19th round, session 286., هرچه منابع نفت بیشتر کشف و یا استخراج می گردد برای مردم ایران اکسیرتر می شود و این کار بدون دلیل نیست و متأسفانه دلیلش پیش زورمندان واضح تر است تا پیش ضعفا و ملت ایران.‎, har-če manâbe'e naft bištar kašf va yâ estexrâj mi-gardad, barâye mardom-e Irân eksir-tar mi-šavad va in kâr bedun-e dalil nist va mote'assefâne dalilaš piš-e zurmandân vâzeh-tar ast tâ piš-e zo'afâ va mellat-e Irân.

(informal, sarcastic) Paragraph (p) (a fictional clause used as a reference to cronyism)., ‏چطوری تونستی تو اون اداره استخدام بشی؟طبق بند پ.‎‎Četori tunesti tu un edâre estexdâm beši?Tebq-e band-e pe.How did you manage to get employed by that office?Per the Paragraph (p).2006 July 16, Kayhan (18566), page 10:, ‏آقاي وزير، بند«پ» را خط بزن‎Mr. Minister, Strike Down the Paragraph (p), 2010 April 21, Iran (4483), page 21:, ‏البته نمايندگي هايي هم بودند كه با آغوش باز كار مشتريانشان را راه مي انداختند كه اين موضوع نيازمند بند معروف «پ» (پارتي) بود.‎‎... though there were VARs which would readily assist their customers, but this case needed the famous Paragraph (p) (cronyism)., 2011 September 26, Shargh (1352), page 3:, ‏استفاده از بند «پ» در پرونده بقايي رييس ديوان عدالت اداري خبر داد‎estefâde az band-e "pe" dar parvande-ye baqâyi ra'is-e divân-e edâlat-e edâri khabar dâdUsing Paragraph (p) in Baqai Case: Head of the Bureau of Administrative Justice Reported, 2011 October 4, Shargh (1359), page 3:, ‏[...] توضيح داد: هر جاي قانون ديوان عدالت اداري را كه گشتيم، چيزي به نام بند«پ» پيدا نكرديم، بنابراين ايشان توضيح دهند منظورشان از بند «پ» چيست تا من بررسي كرده و پاسخ آن را بدهم؛ چرا كه ايشان طوري صحبت كرده اند كه ما واقعا فكر كرديم بند «پ» يك ماده قانوني است.‎‎[...] [he] explained: we could not find anything called "Paragraph (p)" wherever we searched in the Code of the Bureau of Administrative Justice, so he should explain what he meant by "Paragraph (p)" so that I would check and respond, since he talked in such a way that we thought "Paragraph (p)" is actually an article., 2011 October 5, Etemaad (2277), page 3:, ‏«آنقدر بگرديد تا «بند پ» را پيدا كنيد.»‎‎"Search as much as you wish to find the Paragraph (p)"., 2014 July 9, Iran (5690), page 8:, ‏از اين به بعد خريد حمايتي کتاب از ناشران و به دنبال آن تجهيز کتابخانه ها، بدون درنظر گرفتن بند نانوشته«پ» انجام مي شود.‎‎... is done without considering the unwritten Paragraph (p)., 2014 September 18, Shargh (2117), page 7:, ‏اما نمي توان منکر وجود بند «پ» شد و هنوز حضوري جدي دارد.‎‎.. but the existence of Paragraph (p) can not be denied and it still has a strong presence., 2014 September 27, boursenews.ir, "بند" پ" تنها راه یافتن شغل؟":, ‏بند "پ" تنها راه یافتن شغل؟‎‎band-e "pe" tanhâ râh-e yâftan-e šoğl?Paragraph (p), The Only Way to Find a Job?, 2015 May 5, entekhab.ir, "۲.۵ میلیون بیکار به دنبال بند "پ"", ‏2.5 میلیون بیکار به دنبال بند "پ"‎‎2.5 milyun bikâr be dombâl-e yâftan-e band-e "pe"2.5 Million Unemployed People in Search of Paragraph (p)

barren wilderness, the boonies, desert, 858-941, Rudaki, “عصا بیار که وقت عصا و انبان بود”:, بسا شکسته بیابان که باغ خرم بود – و باغ خرم گشت آن کجا بیابان بود, basâ šekaste biâbân ke bâğ-e xorram bud – va bâğ-e xorram gašt ân kojâ biâbân bud, 1315-1390, Hafez, “یوسف گمگشته بازآید به کنعان [From Canaan Joseph Shall Return]”, غزلیات [Ghazaliyyat]:, در بیابان گر به شوق کعبه خواهی زد قدم – سرزنش‌ها گر کند خار مغیلان غم مخور, dar biâbân gar be šouq-e ka'be xâhi zad qadam – sarzaneš-hâ gar konad xâr-r moğilân ğam maxor, 11th cent., Baba Tahir, “مو آن دلدادهٔ بی‌خانمانم”, ‎دوبیتی‌ها [Do-baytīs]:, مو آن دلدادهٔ بی‌خانمانم – مو آن محنت نصیب سخت‌جانم  مو آن سرگشته‌خارم در بیابان – که چون بادی وزد هر سو دوانم, mo ân deldâde-ye bi-xânemânam – mo ân mehnat-nasib-e saxt-jânam  mo ân sargašte-xâram dar biâbân – ke čon bâdi vazad har su davânam, 1184-1291, Saadi, “صید بیابان عشق چون بخورد تیر او”, Bostan:, صید بیابان عشق چون بخورد تیر او – سر نتواند کشید پای ز زنجیر او, seyd-e biâbân-e ešq čon boxorad tir-e u – sar natavanad kešid pây ze zanjir-e u

column5: laughter, 11th century, Abulfazl Bayhaqi, edited by Ali-Akbar Fayyaz, Tarikh-i Bayhaqi, page 83:, ‏و وی هر کسی را لطف می‌کرد و زهر خنده می‌زد – و به هیچ روزگار من او را با خندهٔ فراخ ندیدم، الا همه تبسم، که صعب مردی بود – و سخت فرو شده بود؛ چنان که گفتی می‌داند که چه خواهد بود.‎‎and he was doing acts of kindness to everyone [visiting him] and was doing forced laughing – and in all my life I never saw him with a joyfull laugh, except only smiles, since he was a tough man – and he was so thoughtful

column5: direction, either right or left)#11th century, Abulfazl-i Bayhaqī, Tārīx-i Bayhaqī[1]#‏خواجه امیر حسنک را هر چند خواست که پیش وی بنشیند نگذاشت و بر دست راست من و دست راست خواجه ابوالقاسم کثیر و بونصر مشکان بنشاند، هر چند ابوالقاسم کثیر معزول بود، اما حرمتش سخت بزرگ بود و بوسهل بر دست چپ خواجه، از این نیز سخت‌تر بتابید‎Although Amir Hasanak wanted to sit near him, Khwajah [Ahmad] didn't let it, and seated him at my right-hand, and at Khwajah Abul-Qasim Kasir's and Bu Nasr Mushkan's right-hand—although Abul-Qasim Kasir was deposed, his reverence was so great—and [seated] Bu Sahl at Khwajah's left-hand

column3: (dastâr) (plural دستارها‎ (dastâr-hâ))#turban#11th century, Abulfazl-i Bayhaqī, Tārīx-i Bayhaqī#حسنک پیدا آمد، بی‌بند، جبه‌ای داشت حبری‌رنگ با سیاه می‌زد، خلق‌گونه و دراعه و ردایی سخت پاکیزه و دستاری نشابوری مالیده و موزهٔ میکاییلی نو در پای و موی سر مالیده، زیر دستار پوشیده کرده اندک مایه پیدا می‌بود.‎#Hasanak paydā āmad, bē-band, jubba-ē dāšt hibrī-rang bā siyāh mē-zad, xalaq-gūna u durrā'a u ridā-ē saxt pākīza u dastār-ē nešābūrī mālīda u mōza-i mīkā'īlī-i nō dar pāy u mō-i sar mālīda, zīr-i dastār pōšīda karda, andak māya paydā mē-būd.#dastar#handkerchief#napkin#towel#apronInflectionEdit#Basic forms of دستار (dastâr)##singular#plural#bare#دستار(dastâr)#دستار‌ها(dastâr)دستارا△(dastârấ)#definitive direct object#دستار را(dastâr râ)دستار رو△(dastâro)#دستار‌ها را(dastâr)دستارا رو△(dastârấ ro)#ezâfé#دستار(dastâr-e)#دستار‌های(dastâr)دستارای△(dastârấ-ye)#marked indefiniteor relative definite#دستاری(dastâr-i)#دستار‌هایی(dastâr)دستارایی△(dastârấi)#△ Colloquial.#Possessive forms of دستار (dastâr)##singular#plural#1st person singular(“my”)#دستارم(dastâram)#دستار‌هایم(dastâr-hấyam) دستار‌هام، دستارام△(dastârấm)#2nd person singular(“your”)#دستارت(dastârat) △(dastâret)#دستار‌هایت(dastâr-hấyat) دستار‌هات، دستارات△(dastârất)#3rd person singular(“his, her, its”)#دستارش(dastâraš) △(dastâreš)#دستار‌هایش(dastâr-hấyaš) دستار‌هاش، دستاراش△(dastârấš)#1st person plural(“our”)#دستارمان(dastâremân) دستارمون△(dastâremun)#دستار‌هایمان(dastâr-hấyemân) دستار‌هامون، دستارامون△(dastârấmun)#2nd person plural(“your”)#دستارتان(dastâretân) دستارتون△(dastâretun)#دستار‌هایتان(dastâr-hấyetân) دستار‌هاتون، دستاراتون△(dastârấtun)#3rd person plural(“their”)#دستارشان(dastârešân) دستارشون△(dastârešun)#دستار‌هایشان(dastâr-hấyešân) دستار‌هاشون، دستاراشون△(dastârấšun)#△ Colloquial.#Derived

column3: (rasan)#(archaic) rope, string, cord, thread#11th century, Bayhaqi, Tarikh-e Beyhaqi#‏... و جلادش استوار ببست و رسن‌ها فرود آورد، و آواز دادند که سنگ دهید، هیچکس دست به سنگ نمی‌کرد و همه زارزار می‌گریستند خاصه نیشابوریان، پس مُشتی رند را سیم دادند تا سنگ زنند و مَرد خود مُرده بود که جلادش رسن در گلو افگنده بود و خبه کرده.‎‎... va jallâd-aš ostovâr bebast o rasan-hâ forud âvard, va âvâz dadand ke sang dahid, hičkas dast be sang nemikard o hame zâr-zâr mi-geristand xâsse Neyšâburiyân, pas mošti rend râ sim dâdand tâ sang zanand, va mard xod morde bud, ke jallâd-aš rasan dar galu afgande bud o xabe karde.... and the hangman tied him (Hasanak the Vizier) tightly and pulled down the ropes, and [they] shouted that "throw stones!", [but] nobody was picking up stones and all were crying loudly, especially the Nishapuris, so they paid silver [coins] to a bunch of thugs to throw stones, and [but] the man was already dead, as the hangman had put the rope on his neck and [had him] strangled.

And this river is called "sinful" because it is flowing toward Rome [Byzantine Empire], that is to say, since it is going from the lands of Islam to the lands of kufr, it is "sinful", and over [the] river they have built many Persian wheels.

(ğorbat)#the state or feeling of being a foreigner and/or longing for one's native land#‏غم غربت‎ğam-e ğorbatthe unpleasant feeling of being in a foreign place(literally, “sorrow of being in a foreign place”)Usage notesEdit#The words غریب‎ (ğarib), غریبی‎ (ğaribi), and غربت‎ (ğorbat) are used when talking from the point of view of the foreigner, e.g. when the speaker himself/herself is a foreigner
column4: for example:#‏اینجا تو آلمان خیلی غریبم.‎‎I [feel] so much [like] a foreigner here in Germany.#‏غم غربت پدرمو در آورد.‎‎ğam-e ğorbat pedaramo dar âvord.I'm sick and tired of the pain of foreignness.#‏غریبی نکن! باهام حرف بزن.‎‎Don't feel to be a stranger! Talk with me.

(archaic) Frank, French, (archaic) crusader, 1184–1291, Saadi, Golestan, ‏از صحبت یاران دمشقم ملالتی پدید آمده بود، سر در بیابان قدس نهادم و با حیوانات انس گرفتم تا وقتی که اسیر قید فرنگ شدم و در خندق طرابلس با جهودانم به کارگل داشتند.‎‎az suhbat-i yārān-i Damišqam malālati padīd āmada būd, sar dar biyābān-i Quds nahādam u bā haywānāt uns giriftam tā waqtī ki asīr-i qayd-i Farang šudam u dar xandaq-i Tarābulus bā Jahūdānam ba kārgil dāštand.I was upset from my Damascene friends and went to the desert of Palestine (...), until I was taken as captive by the Franks/Crusaders and they sent me with Jews as forced labourers to Tripoli, [Lebanon]., (archaic) European, (archaic) Christian, 1141–1209, Nezami, ‏فرنگ فلسطین و رهبان روم  پذیرای فرمان مهرش چو موم‎Farang-i Filistīn u rahbān-i Rōm  paḏīrā-yi farmān-i mihraš ču mōm(please add an English translation of this usage example)(archaic) Francia, 1045–1052, Nasir Khusraw, Safarnama, ‏باجگاهی است آن جا که کشتی های که از اطراف روم و فرنگ و اندلس و مغرب بیاید عشر به سلطان دهند‎bājgāhē ast ānjā ki kaštī-hā'ē ki az atrāf-i Rōm u Farang u Andalus u Mağrib biyāyand ušr ba sultān dahand.... there is a place to collect tribute over there through which the ships that come from Rum [Anatolia], Francia, Al-Andalus, and Maghreb pay ushr [one-tenth of the earned profit] to the sultan ..., (dated) France, (dated) Western world, especially Europe

Qarmatian, 11th century, Abulfazl-i Bayhaqī, Tārīx-i Bayhaqī[1], ‏به این خلیفهٔ خرف شده بباید نبشت که من از بهر عباسیان انگشت در کرده‌ام در همهٔ جهان و قرمطی می‌جویم و آنچه یافته آید و درست گردد بر دار می‌کشند، و اگر مرا درست شدی که حسنک قرمطی است خبر به امیرالمؤمنین رسیدی که در باب وی چه رفتی. وی را من پرورده‌ام و با فرزندان و برادران من برابر است. اگر وی قرمطی است من هم قرمطی باشم. هر چند آن سخن پادشاهانه نبود، بدیوان آمدم و چنان نبشتم‎"ba īn xalīfa-i xarif šuda bi-bāyad nibišt ki man az bahr-i Abbāsiyān angušt dar karda-am dar hama-i jahān u Qarmatī mē-jōyam u ān-či yāfta āyad u durust gardad bar dār mē-kašand, va agar marā durust šudē ki Hasanak Qarmatī ast xabar ba Amīrulmu'minīn rasīdē ki dar bāb-i vay či raftē. vay rā man parvarda-am u bā farzandān u barādarān-i man barābar ast. agar vay Qarmatī ast man ham Qarmatī bāšam." har čand ān suxan-i pādišāhāna nabūd, ba-dīwān āmadam u čunīn nibištam."Such should be written to this senile Caliph, that because of Abbasids I've seeked in all of the world and look for Qarmatians, and the ones that are found and are proven would be hanged, and if it becomes proven to me that Hasanak is a Qarmatian, the news would reach the Amir al-Mu'minin that what would happen to him. He has been raised by me and is equal to my children and brothers. If he is a Qarmatian, I would be a Qarmatian, too." Although it was not a royal speech, I came to the divan and wrote as such., (archaic) infidel
Alternative form of قرمه سبزی‎ (qorme sabzi)

(mâl) (plural اموال‎ (amvâl) or مال‌ها‎ (mâl-hâ))#property#اون سگ بزرگ مال توست؟‎#un sag-e bozorg mâl-e to-st?#Is that big dog yours?#این کتاب مال من نیست.‎#in ketâb mâl-e man nist.#This book isn't mine.#wealth#money#assetsUsage notesEdit#As seen in example sentences above, in the sense of "property", this noun can be used with ezâfe to approximate the English possessive pronouns. For example, "mine" would be rendered مال من (mâl-e man) and "yours" as مال تو (mâl-e to).#Related

(now') (plural انواع‎ (anvâ') or نوع‌ها‎ (now'-hâ))#type, kind, sort#Synonym: گونه‎ (gune)#‏آش جو یک نوع از انواع آش‌های ایرانی است. در طبخ این نوع آش از سبزیجات معطر و مخصوص آش نظیر: تره، جعفری، گشنیز، شوید و حبوبات نظیر نخود، لوبیا، عدس و برنج و جو پوست گرفته، پیاز و کشک غلیظ زردچوبه و روغن استفاده می‌شود و این آش با نعناداغ و پیاز داغ تزئین و مصرف می‌شود‎Âsh-e-joo [lit. 'barley porridge] is one [type] among the many types of Iranian porridge. In the cooking of this type of porridge the proper spicy greens to be used are the likes of chives, parsley, coriander and dill along with peeled beans such as peas, haricots, lentils, barley, onions and [also] curded turmeric and oil. Fried-mint and cooked onion[slices] are placed as garnishment over the porridge before consumptionDerived

missing good opportunities to score a goal, روزنامه شرق، شماره 1011 23/4/89، صفحه 15, ‏اما تورس 2010 مهاجمي بي خطر، كند و گل نزن بود.‎‎Ammâ Tores-e 2010 mohâjemi bi-xatar, kond, va gol-nazan bud.But Torres of 2010 was an harmless, slow, and gol-nazan attacker., روزنامه كيهان، شماره 18500 5/2/85، صفحه 13, ‏ويارئال اسپانيا- آرسنال انگلستان مهاجمان گل نزن سد دفاعي مستحكم!‎‎Viyâre'âl-e Espâniyâ - Ârsenl-e Engelestân Mohajemân-e Gol-nazan, Sadd-e Defâ'i-ye Mostahkam!Villarreal of Spain - Arsenal of UK: Gol-nazan Attackers, Strong Defensice Line!, روزنامه كيهان، شماره 21222 10/9/94، صفحه 9, ‏«پرسپوليس گل نزن» مقابل نفت دو امتياز از دست داد‎"TPerspolis-e Gol-nazan moqâbel-e Naft Do Emtiyâz Az Dast Dâd"The Gol-nazan Persepolis" Lost Two Points to Naft, 26 February 2016, Tabnak, ‏پیشنهاد قهرمان آسیا به مهاجم گل نزن تیم ملی ایران‎pišnahâd-e qahremân-e âsiyâ be mohâjem-e gol nazan-e tim-e melli-ye irân(please add an English translation of this usage example), [1], ‏گل نزن ترین بازیکن سال فوتبال‎gol nazan tarin bâzikon-e sâl-e futbâlThe Most Gol Nazan Player of the Yeara player who misses good opportunities to score a goal too often, ‏عجب گل‌نزنیه این بازیکن!‎‎ajab gol-nazani-ye in bâzikon!This player is such a gol-nazan!روزنامه شرق، شماره 2462 10/9/94، صفحه 18, ‏پرسپوليس تيم گل نزن ها‎Perspolis Tim-e Gol-nazan-hâPersepolis, The Team of Gol-Nazans, [2], ‏تمرینات ویژه برای گل نزن های استقلال/عکس‎tamrinât-e viže barâye gol-nazan-hâye esteqlâl/aksSpecial Training for Gol-Nazans of Esteghlal [F.C.]/Photo

(gonâh) (plural گناهان‎ (gonâhân) or گناه‌ها‎ (gonâh-hâ))#sin#crime, guilt#11th century, Abul-Fazl Bayhaqi, Tarikh-e Beyhaqi[1]#‏امیر گفت: پس از حسنک درین باب چه گناه بوده است؟ که اگر راه بادیه آمدی در خون آنهمه خلق شدی‎Amir goft: "pas az Hasanak darin bâb če gonâh bude ast? ke agar râh-e bâdiye âmadi, dar xun-e ânhame xalq šodi."Amir said: "So what was Hasanak's crime here? to fade from memory, to be forgotten, فکر می‌کنم احتمالاً از خاطرش رفته‌ام.‎, Fekr mi-konam ehtemâlan az xâtereš raft-ám., I think he/she has probably forgotten me. (more literally, I think probably I have gone from his/her memory), — امیدوارم اون فیلم یکروز از خاطرم بره.‎, — واقعا اونقدر بد بود؟‎, — به طور عجیبی وحشتناک بود.‎, — Omid-vâram un film yekruz az xâteram bere., — Vâqean unqadr bad bud?, — Be towr-e ajibi vahšatnâk bud., — I hope one day I forget that movie., — Was it really that bad?, — It was surprisingly horrible.

(archaic) to take, seize, Abulfazl Bayhaqi, edited by Ali-Akbar Fayyaz, Bayhaqi's History, page 91:, ‏تا بدان جایگاه که گفت: «از بونصر سیصد هزار دینار بتوان استد» سلطان گفت: «بونصر را این زرِ بسیار نیست، و از کجا استد؟ و اگر هستی، کفایت او ما را به از این مال. حدیثِ وی کوتاه باید کرد که همداستان نیستم که نیز حدیث او کنید»‎‎to the extent that he [Bu Sahl Zawzani] said: "Three thousand dinars could be seized from Bu Nasr." Sultan said: "Bu Nasr does not own this amount of gold – and how to seize? And [even] if he does have, his competence worth this money. [This] talking about him must be stopped, because I do not agree that you talk about him anymore."

to card (wool or cotton), to tease (separate the fibres)

Used to render the verb "to dislike"., از این کتاب بدم می‌آید.‎, Az in ketâb badam mi-âyad. (more literary), از این کتاب بدم می‌آد.‎, Az in ketâb badam mi-âd. (more colloquial), I dislike this book., از فیلم‌های آمریکایی بدمان می‌آید, Az film-hâ-ye âmrikâyi bademân mi-âyad. (more literary), از فیلم‌های آمریکایی بدمون می‌آد, Az filmâ-ye âmrikâyi bademun mi-âd. (more colloquial), We dislike American films.

(archaic) to stand up, 11th century, Abu'l-Fadl Bayhaqi, Tarikh-i Bayhaqi, ‏چون حسنک بیامد، خواجه بر پای خاست. چون او این مَکرمُت بکرد، همه – اگر خواستند یا نه – بر پای خاستند. بو سهل زوزنی بر خشم خود طاقت نداشت؛ برخاست، نه تمام و بر خویشتن می ژکید. احمد او را گفت: در همه کارها ناتمامی. وی نیک از جای بشد.‎‎When Hasanak came, Khwaja stood up. Since he performed this act of respect, everyone – whether they wanted or not – stood up. Bu Sahl Zawzani couldn't contain his anger
column4: he stood up, but not completely, and was grumbling to himself. Ahmad said to him: "In all tasks, you perform incompletely." He became extremely angered.

column3: (archaic, dialectal) to stand, to get up (to rise to one's feet), (archaic, poetic, dialectal) to rise
to breathe into, to blow, to inflate, to sprout, to grow, to shoot

column5: to fry, Bible Ezekiel 4:9:پس‌ گندم‌ و جو و باقلا و عدس‌ و ارزن‌ و ماشک برای‌ خود گرفته‌، آنها را در یك‌ ظرف‌ بریز و خوراكی‌ از آنها برای‌ خود بپزThus, take with you wheat, barley, beans, lentiles, millet and vetch and, having placed them in a pot, roast them and feed yourself with that which you have cooked

column3: to set up, The Bible, Ezekiel 4:2:شهر را محاصره‌ كن‌ و در برابرش‌ برجها ساخته‌، سنگری‌ در مقابلش‌ برپا نما و به‌ اطرافش‌ اردو زده‌، منجنیقها به‌ هر سوی‌ آن‌ برپا كن‌‌Besiege the city and build in front of it (siege) towers, place your battering ram facing it, encamp on its flanks and towards it set up all your catapults, to position, to establish
(transitive) to translate, (transitive) to return (something), give back, hand back

to return, to come back, 2013, Ehsan Khajeh Amiri, "Be Dadam Beres [به دادم برس]", تمام عمر رد شدم ازت ببین کجا شدم اسیر تو  به پشت سر نگاه نمی‌کنم که برنگردم از مسیر تو, tamâm-e 'omr rad šodam az-at, bebin kojâ šodam asir-e to  be pošt-e-sar negâh nemikonam ke barnagardam az masir-e to
to cut, ‏در كوه‌ها چوب‌ می‌برد‎dar kuh-hâ čub mi-boradHe chops wood in the mountains, to become fed up, ‏از این دنیا بریدم‎az in donyâ boridamI'm fed up with this world

(Iran) to grow up, grow, برادر او در ایران چشم به جهان گشود، ولی در ترکیه بزرگ می‌شود.‎, Barâdar-e u dar Irân češm be jahân gošud, vali dar Torkiye bozorg mi-šavad. (more literary), برادرش توی ایران چشم به جهان گشود، ولی توی ترکیه بزرگ می‌شه.‎, Barâdaraš tu-ye Irân češm be jahân gošud, vali tu-ye Torkiye bozorg mi-še. (more colloquial), Her brother was born in Iran, but is growing up in Turkey.

column4: to know how, انگلیسی بلدید؟‎, Engelisi baladid?, Do you know English?, فارسی بلد نیستم.‎, Fârsi balad nistam., I don't know Persian.

column3: to swallow, to devour, to inhale
to raise, دشمن دانا بلندت می‌کند. بر زمینت می‌زند نادان دوست.‎, Došşman-e dânâ bolandat mi-konad. Bar zaminat mi-zanad nâdân-e dust., The wise enemy lifts you up. The ignorant friend casts you down.
to go to sleep, می‌خواهم به خواب بروم.‎, Mi-xâham be xâb beravam. (more literary), می‌خوام به خواب برم.‎, Mi-xâm be xâb beram. (more colloquial), I want to go to sleep.
to disarrange, 2012, Ali Lohrasbi, همه شهر و به هم می‌زدم اما چقدر پیش تو بی‌اراده بودم, hame šahr o be ham mi-zadam amma čeqadr piš-e to bi-erâde budam, to blend
to come into existence, to appear
(colloquial) to come into existence, (colloquial) to appear
to remember, to recall, نامش رو به یاد نمی‌آرم.‎, Nấmeš-o be yâd némi-âram., I can't remember his name.
to be (See the Usage Notes), to exist
(intransitive) to awake, to wake up, to be alert
(transitive) to wake up, بیدارش نکن.‎, Bidấreš nákon., Don't wake him/her up.

(bidan) (present stem بو‎ (bu) or باش‎ (bâš))#(dialectal, Bushehr, Abadeh, Khesht, Konartakhteh, Dashtestan) to be (See the Usage Notes)#(dialectal, Bushehr, Abadeh, Khesht, Konartakhteh, Dashtestan) to exist

(idiomatic) to perform an action before considering the risks associated, (idiomatic) to make a decision before considering its aspects or facets ^   http://www.negahmedia.ir/media/show_podcast/96531 , ,

column6: raid

column3: to twist, to twine ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007)  Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series
column4: 2), Leiden, Boston: Brill, →ISBN, page 389, , to heat, to shine

column3: to tolerate, ما کارگران وضعیت موجود را تحمل نخواهیم کرد.‎, Mâ kârgarân vaz'iyyat-e mowjud râ tahammol naxâhim kard., Us workers will not tolerate the status quo., to endure
(dialectal, Kazerun) to shave, (dialectal, Kazerun) to erase
to shave, to scrape, to carve

to prefer, این کتاب‌های جدید رو ترجیح می‌دم. فکر می‌کنم از بقیه جالب‌ترن.‎, In ketâbâ-ye jadid ro tarjih mi-dam. Fekr mi-konam az baqiye jâleb-tar-an., I prefer these new books. I think they are more interesting than the others.
(auxiliary, dialectal, Khesht, Konartakhteh) to be able
to fear, از من می‌ترسند.‎, Az man mitarsand., They're afraid of me.
to burst (to break from internal pressure)
(intransitive) to surrender, give in, give up
to conform, to be conform, to agree, to correspond, to be similar or analogous
(idiomatic, informal) to practice taarof in an excessive manner

column4: to be polite and deferential, to compliment or flatter
column5: to be generous, to serve or offer

column3: to repair, to fix, ‏باید این ماشین را تعمیر کنیم‎We have to repair this car
to regard, .او مالیات‌ها را به عنوان باری سنگین تلقی می‌کند, U māliyāt-hā rā be 'onvān-e bāri sangin talaqi mikonad., He regards taxes as a heavy burden.
to be completed, to be finished, to end
to complete, to finish, to use up
to practice (to use a skill repeatedly or habitually to improve one's proficiency therein)
to strain, to squeeze, to twist, to roll together, to draw tight, to be distressed, sad
to set, adjust (a clock, device), to fix, arrange (an appointment)
to spin (a thread, a web, a cocoon, etc.), to weave, to twist, (archaic) to pay attention

column4: can, نمی‌تواند با شما برود.‎, Nemi-tavânad bâ šomâ beravad. (more literary), نمی‌تونه با شما بره.‎, Nemi-tune bâ šomâ bere. (more colloquial), He can't go with you., توانسته‌ای حمام کنی؟‎, Tavâneste-i hammâm koni? (more literary), تونسته‌ای حموم کنی؟‎, Tunesti hamum koni? (more colloquial), Were you able to get a bath?
to concentrate, استاد بهمون گفت که توجه کنیم.‎, Ostâd behemun goft ke tavajjoh konim., The professor told us to pay attention.
can, برادرت عربی می‌تونه حرف بزنه؟‎, Barâdaret Arabi mi-tune harf be-zane?, Can your brother speak Arabic?

column3: (intransitive) to quake, to shake, Synonyms: جم خوردن‎ (jom xordan), جنبیدن‎ (jonbidan), لرزیدن‎ (larzidan), (intransitive) to move, Synonyms: حرکت کردن‎ (harekat kardan), جنبیدن‎ (jonbidan)

column6: to move, to lose wight from heavy motion and movement, to shake (a carpet), to run to and fro

column3: to call a mobile phone and let it ring once (usually to tell the other person to call back, or to let the other person to easily save the first person's number to his phone's memory, without having to enter it manually)
(intransitive) to integrate, settle in, fit in
(transitive) to fit (in a space), make room for
to leave behind, to forget, to mislay, to indent, to space, to leave space

to separate, to be separated, to get divorced, پدر و مادر شبنم جدا شده‌اند.‎, Pedar va mâdar-e Šabnam jodâ šode-and. (more literary), پدر و مادر شبنم جدا شدن.‎, Pedar o mâdar-e Šabnam jodâ šodan. (more colloquial), Shabnam's father and mother got divorced.
to part, to divide, to disunite, to dissolve
to jumpto search, to seek, to look
(intransitive, of people) to gather together, gather up, assemble, gather as a group, (intransitive, of things) to gather up, accumulate
to shake, quiver, vibrate, to move around, fidget
column4: wiggle around, to move it, get a move on
to speak, میل دارم با شما حرف بزنم.‎, Meyl dâram bâ šomâ harf bezanam., I'd like to speak with you.

column3: to move, shift, change places or position
to sense, to feel, شادمهر عقیلی، تقدیر, وقتی به من فکر می‌کنی، حس می‌کنم از راه دور.‎, Vaqti be man fekr mi-koni, hes mi-konam az râh-e dur., When you think of me, I sense it from afar., to perceive
(vulgar) to get horny, to become sexually aroused
to bathe, to have a bath, to take a bath
turn off, switch off, extinguish, stop
to ruin, to destroy, to spoil
to cry aloud, shout, to roar
to scratch, to scratch out, to cross out
(obsolete) to hurt by introducing a sharp point, to sting
to neutralize, to counteract, to counterbalance, to nullify, to annul
to fall asleep, ‏دیشب زود خوابم برد.‎‎Dišab zud xấbam bord.Last night I fell asleep early.
to sleep, to lie down, (slang) to die down
(xvârdan) (present stem خوار‎ (xvâr))#(dialectal) to eat#(dialectal) to drink
(auxiliary) to want (to do something), to want, to intend

to read, برای خواندن همه این کتاب‌ها وقت ندارم.‎, Barấ-ye xándán-e hamé-ye in ketâb-hấ vaqt nádâram., I don't have time to read all of these books., to recite, to sing, to study, (archaic, peotic) to beckon
to request, خواهش کردم که با من و خانوادم در تهران بمانند.‎, Xâheš kardam ke bâ man o xânevâdam dar Tehrân bemânand., I requested that they stay with me and my family in Tehran.
to deceive oneself, خودمان را گول نزنیم.‎, Xódemân râ gul názanim. (more literary), Let us not fool ourselves., خودت رو گول نزن.‎, Xódet o gul názan. (more colloquial), Don't fool yourself.
to feed, Synonym: غذا دادن‎ (ğazâ dâdan)
to eat, ‏امروز چی خورده‌ای؟‎‎Emruz či xordí?What have you eaten today?, to drink, (with به‎) to run into, collide with

Used to render the verb "to like"., از این کتاب خوشم می‌آید.‎, Az in ketâb xošam mi-âyad. (more literary), از این کتاب خوشم می‌آد.‎, Az in ketâb xošam mi-âd. (more colloquial), I like this book., از تو خوشش می‌آید.‎, Az to xošaš mi-âyad. (more literary), از تو خوشش می‌آد.‎, Az to xošeš mi-âd. (more colloquial), He/she likes you., از فیلم‌های خوب خوشمان می‌آید, Az film-hâ-ye xub xošemân mi-âyad. (more literary), از فیلم‌های خوب خوشمون می‌آد, Az filmâ-ye xub xošemun mi-âd. (more colloquial), We like good films.
to pass pleasantly (said of time), (with به‎) to have a good time, ‏به من خوش گذشت‎be man xoš gozaštI had a good time
to wet, to soak, to drench
to wet, to water, to soak, to drench

to give, کتابی را که به من داد گم کردی؟‎, Ketâb-i râ ke be man dâd gom kardi? (more literary), Did you lose the book he gave me?, کتابی رو که بهم داد گم کردی؟‎, Ketâb-i ro ke behem dâd gom kardi? (more colloquial), Did you lose the book he gave me?, کتابیو که بهم داد گم کردی؟‎, Ketâb-iyo ke behem dâd gom kardi? (more colloquial), Did you lose the book he gave me?
to have, to possess (lit. to be possessor of), پارس دارای دو معنی و مفهوم گوناگون است.‎, Pârs dârấ-ye do ma'ní vo mafhúm gunâgún ast., "Pârs" has two different meanings.

to have, چهار تا بچه داریم.‎, Čahâr tâ bačče dârim., We have four children., to hold, to possess, to own, (auxiliary, colloquial) to be (doing something), دارم می‌روم.‎, dâram mi-ravam., I am going., داشتی قدم می‌زدی.‎, dâšti qadam mi-zadi., You were walking. ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007)  Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series

to know (something), Rumi, Diwan-e_Shams-e_Tabrizi, خوش باش که هر که راز داند داند که خوشی خوشی کشاند, Xoš bâš ke har ke râz dânad dânad ke xoši xoši kešânad, Be happy, for everyone who knows (this) secret knows that happiness attracts happiness.
(informal) to get away (to escape), نتونستیم دزد و پیدا کنیم قبل از اینکه در رفت.‎, Natunestim dozd o peydâ konim qabl az inke dar raft., We were unable to find the thief before got away.
to enter, come inside, to arrive
(obsolete) To speak, say, chatter, babble, ‏ژاژ دراییدن‎ ― žâž darâyidan ― to lie, ‏هرزه دراییدن‎ ― harze darâyidan ― to say nonsense
(intransitive) to hurt, پایم درد گرفت.‎, Pâ-yam dard gereft., My leg hurts.
to fix, to mend, to repair, to correct, to make, to prepare, غذایمان را درست کرد.‎, Ğazâyemân râ dorost kard., She prepared our meal.
to reap, mow, Synonym: درو کردن‎ (derav kardan)
to lie, to tell lies, to speak falsely

column5: to comprehend, Synonym: فهمیدن‎ (fahmidan), to realise, to perceive

column3: to ravage, to attack, to bite
to arrest (to seize someone with the authority of the law)
to bury, ‏همین الان دفن کردن چندتا بچه‌گربه رو انجام دادم.‎‎Hamin alân dafn kardan-e čand-tâ bačče-gorba ro anjâm dâdam.I just got done burying some kittens.
(idiomatic) to risk, بیا دلمون رو به دریا بزنیم, biyâ delemun ro be daryâ bezanim, Lets riskمجید اخشابی، «فصل پرواز»‎, دل به دریا زدی اما بی هوا ...‎, del be daryâ zadi ammâ bi-havâ ...

(of things) to become uninteresting, boring, unpleasant, or repulsive as a result of excessiveness or passage of time, ‏دیگه نمی‌تونم از این کیک بخورم، خیلی خامه داره و دلمو زده.‎‎I can eat no more of this cake
column4: it has too much cream and it has become unpleasant. (informal), ‏این گوشی رو دوست داشتم ولی بعد این چند سال دیگه دلمو زده و می‌خوام بفروشمش.‎‎I loved this phone but it has become boring after so many years, so I want to sell it. (informal), ‏محبت زیادی دل او را می‌زند.‎‎[Receiving] too much love would make him/her uninterested.

column3: to breathe, to blow, to sprout, to grow, to shoot

column4: to be after, دنبال چیزی هستی؟‎, Donbâl-e čizi hasti?, Are you looking for something?, دنبال یه کتابی از سیمین دانشور هستم.‎, Donbâl-e ye ketâb-i az Simin-e Dânešvar hastam., I'm looking for a certain book by Simin Daneshvar.

column3: (in present tense) to be looking for, — ببخشید آقا. دنبال کسی می‌گردید؟‎, — بله. دنبال برادر کوچیکم می‌گردم.‎, — Bebaxšid âqâ. Donbâl-e kasi mi-gardid?, — Bale. Donbâl-e barâdar-e kučikam mi-gardam., — Excuse me, sir. Are you looking for someone?, — Yes. I'm looking for my little brother.
to come after, come for, come get
to go after, to follow, to pursue
to walk with pomposity, to boil with rage, to run with alacrity and joy

column3: (literally) to pick up or lift two watermelons using one hand, (idiomatic) to start or try to do two difficult tasks simultaneously and not to succeed in either one
to sew(archaic, literary) to milk, ‏گاو را دوخت.‎‎gâv-râ duxthe milked the cow, Synonym: دوشیدن‎ (dušidan)

to like, to love, تو را دوست دارم.‎, To râ dust dâram. (literary), دوس‍ت دارم.‎, Duset dâram. (colloquial, most common form in colloquial Tehrani), دوست‍ت دارم.‎, Dustet dâram. (colloquial, an occasional form in colloquial Tehrani), I love you., تو رو دوس(‍ت) دارم.‎, To ro dus(t) dâram. (colloquial)
to take a bath or shower, می‌خوام دوش بگیرم پیش از سپیده.‎, Mi-xâm duš begiram piš az sepide., I want to take a shower before dawn.
(dialectal, Rochan, Baft County, Kerman Province, transitive) to milk (a cow, etc)
(Iran, colloquial) to put off, temporize, delay

to see, ‏آیا می‌خواهی چیزِ شگفت‌انگیزی ببینی؟‎‎âyâ Mi-xâhi čiz-e šegeft-angiz-i bebini?do you want to see something wonderful? (formal), ‏می‌خوای یه چیزِ شگفت‌انگیز ببینی؟‎‎Mi-xây ye čiz-e šegeft-angiz bebini?Do you want to see something wonderful? (colloquial) ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007)  Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series
to store, stock, stock up, to save (for example, a file on the computer)
to tell the truth, to be truthful
to ride, to drive, to steer, to conn, to pilot, to run, to control or manage

to refuse, to reject, to veto
to escape, to free, to liberateto grow
to arrive, to reach, to have time
to spin (to make yarn)to color, to dye

(dialectal, Isfahan) to go, (dialectal, Isfahan) to leave, (dialectal, Isfahan) to depart, (dialectal, Isfahan) to pass away, to die(dialectal, Isfahan) to sweep
to liberate, to free, to rescue, Synonyms: آزاد کردن‎‎‎, رهایی دادن‎, نجات دادن‎, رها کردن‎‎‎
to make clear, to illuminate, to brighten, to turn on
to pour, to spill, to sprinkle
(vulgar) to shit ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007) , “*HraiH”, in Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series

column4: Making yarn by twisting and winding fibers together.

column3: to labor, to toil, to work or try hard

to remove (dirt, an impurity, body hair, etc.), to clean, cleanse, clear, purify
long live!long live, !زنده باد میهن, Zende bâd mihan!, Long live the country!
to live, فرزانه در ایران زندگی می‌کند.‎, Farzâne dar Irân zendegi mi-konad. (literary), فرزانه تو ایران زندگی می‌کنه.‎, Farzâne tu Irân zendegi mi-kone. (colloquial), Farzaneh lives in Iran.
to call, telephone, ring upto get rusty, corrode
to make, to build, to construct, to create, to produce, to endure, to bear
(slang, vulgar) to suck (penis), to blow, to give head
to wipe, to clean, to shave
(literary or dialectal) Alternative form of سوختن‎ (suxtan, “to burn”)(literary or archaic) Alternative form of سنجیدن‎ (sanjidan, “to compare, weigh”)
to speak, to talk, to converse
(intransitive, preceded by با) to put up with (someone), (transitive) to get through, struggle through, withstand (for example, a difficult period of time)
(idiomatic) to spend more money, to spend money more readily (literally, "to loosen the drawstring of the bag")
to sing, chant, to recite, to compose
to be worthy, to merit, to deserve, to fit, to suit
To order (to request some product or service)
to long for someone, to love

(archaic or dialectal) to weigh, to measure, to evaluate, to ponder, reflect ^  Bailey, H. W. (1979)  Dictionary of Khotan Saka, Cambridge, London, New York, Melbourne: Cambridge University press, page 406b, ,  ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007) , “*θanĵ”, in Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series

column3: to burn, ‏دستم سوخته.‎‎ ― Dast-am suxte. ― My hand got burned. / I burned my hand.Bīdel Dehlavī, Qazaliyat, ‏یاد وصلی کردم آغوش من دیوانه سوخت  لاله‌سان از گرمی این می دل پیمانه سوخت  ناله ها رفت از دل و احرام آزادی نبست  پرتو خود را در اول شمع این کاشانه سوخت‎yâd-e vasl-i kardam âğuš-e man-e divâne suxt, lâle-sân az garmi-ye in del peymâne suxt, nâle ha raft az del o ahrâm âzâdi nabast, parto-ve xod râ dar owl-e šam’-e in kâšâne suxt., (figurative, idiomatic) to suffer, ‏دوستم به خاطر مرگ پدرش سوخت.‎‎ ― Dust-am be xâter-e marg-e pedar-eš suxt. ― My friend suffered because of the death of his father., (figurative, idiomatic) to be lost
column4: be ruined (of plans, opportunities, success), ‏اگر از فرصت‌ها استفاده نکنید، می‌سوزند.‎‎ ― Agar az forsat-hâ estefâde na-konid, mi-suzand. ― If you don't use the opportunities, they will be lost.

column3: to be thankful, to be grateful

(obsolete) to traverse, to passto commit, to entrust, commend, to deposit, to order ^  MacKenzie, D. N. (1971)  A concise Pahlavi dictionary, London, New York, Toronto: Oxford University Press, page 3, ,
(obsolete) to jump, leap, Synonyms: پریدن‎ (paridan), جستن‎ (jastan), (obsolete) to kick, Synonym: لگد زدن‎ (lagad zadan)

(archaic) to think, consider, discuss, 9th century, Firdowsi, Shahnameh, ‏تو بیکاری و جان بکار اندر دارد  سر بد سگالت به دار اندر است‎tu be-kār-ī u jān ba kār andar dāradsar-ī bad-sigāl-at ba dār andar dāradSynonyms: اندیشیدن‎ (andišidan), فکر کردن‎ (fekr kardan)
(vulgar) to eat cock, to suck cock, to give head
to scathe, injure, hurt, to scratch, scrape
to become, (in passive constructions) to be, to be possible, ‏اگر بشود‎agar bešavadif it's possible, (archaic) to go, to come to, (mathematics, informal) to equal
to explain, به خونوادم شرح دادم چرا نمی‌تونم با اونا برم فلاورجان.‎, Be xunevâdam šarh dâdam čerâ nemi-tunam bâ onâ beram Falâvarjân., I explained to my family why I can't go with them to Falavarjan.
to begin, to start, دیروز شروع به خوندن کتاب جدیدی کردم.‎, Diruz šoru be xundan-e ketâb-e jadid-i kardam., I started reading a new book yesterday., to commence

(dialectal, Bushehr, Khesht, Konartakhteh, Dashtestan) to wash
(vulgar) to get an erection, to get a hard-on
to count, to add, to consider, to reckon
to add up, to calculate, to compute, to count, to reckon
to faint, to be confounded, to buck(dialectal) to drink (consume liquid through the mouth)

to know, to be acquainted with, پدرتون رو از بچگی می‌شناسم.‎, Pedáretun-o az baččegí mí-šnâsam., I've known your father since childhood., to acknowledge, to discern, to distinguish, to inform, to make known, to define, to describe, to recognize, فکر می‌کنم آن مرد را می‌شناسم.‎, Fekr mi-konam ân mard râ mi-šenâsam., فکر می‌کنم اون مرد و می‌شناسم.‎, Fekr mi-konam un mard o mi-šnâsam., I think I recognize that man.
to cleave, cut, incise, to rupture, to split
to defeat (the act of defeating or being defeated)
(in general, of an object, a law, a promise, silence, etc.) to break
to be patient, wait, to tolerate
(transitive) to stand, put up with, tolerate
to love, عاشق برادرشم.‎, 'Âšéq-e barâdárešam., I love his/her brother., عاشقتم.‎, 'Âšéqetam., I love you.
(intransitive) to be infected, get infected, ‏دستش عفونت کرد‎ ― dast-eš 'ofunat kard ― His hand / arm got infected.
to be interested (in), to have or take interest (in), به علم علاقه دارم.‎, Be 'elm 'alâqe dâram., I'm interested in science.
to act or feel shy, reserved, or scared, especially of small children, due to presence of strangers or unrelated people
to take a bath, take a shower, bathe., to perform ghusl
to be sad, ‏چرا غصه خوردی؟‎‎Why are you sad?
to escape, to flee, نتوانستیم دزد را پیدا کنیم قبل از اینکه فرار کرد.‎, Natavânestim dozd râ peydâ konim qabl az inke farâr kard., We were unable to find the thief before he escaped.
to order, to command, (deferential, formal) to say, ‏چی فرمودید؟‎‎či farmudid?What did you say?
to educate, to teach, to nurture
to sell, ‏کتاب درباره تاریخ ایران مى‌فروشيد؟‎‎Ketâb dar-bâre-ye târix-e Irân mi-forušid?Do you sell books about the history of Iran?
(intransitive) to pry, stick one's nose in, ‏در کار دیگران فضولی کردن‎ ― dar kâr-e digarân fozuli kardan ― to pry into other people's business, stick one's nose into other people's business
to explain, to make understood, to make clear
to understand (hear correctly and know the language), to understand intellectually
column5: to comprehend, Synonym: درک کردن‎ (dark kardan), نمی‌فهمم چرا از شعر پارسی خوشتان نمی‌آید.‎, Nemi-fahmam čerâ az še'r-e Pârsi xošetân nemi-âyad., I don't understand why you don't like Persian poetry., (Dari, colloquial) to know

column3: to think, الان به چی فکر می‌کنی؟‎, Alân be či fekr mi-koni?, What are you thinking about right now?
(archaic) Alternative form of افکندن‎, آمد نسیم و نکهت گل در جهان فکند از عبید زاکانی, آمد نسیم و نکهت گل در جهان فکند‎, بلبل ز شوق غلغه در بوستان فکند‎
to lend, می‌شه یه کتاب بهم قرض بدی؟‎, Mi-še ye ketâb behem qarz bedi?, Could you lend me a book?

(transitive) to interrupt, break off (to disturb or halt an ongoing process or action temporarily or permanently), (transitive) to cut off, stop, interrupt (for example, the power supply, the Internet connection), (transitive) to cut down (a tree)
to need, کمک کنید لازم دارم.‎, Komak konid lâzem dâram., I need your help.
to shiver, shudder, ‏لرزیدن از ترس‎larzidan az tarsto shiver from fear, ‏لرزیدن از سرما‎larzidan az sarmâto shiver from the cold, to shake, tremble
to get smashed, to get squashed
(obsolete) to milk, Synonym: دوشیدن‎ (dušidan), (obsolete) to drink, Synonyms: خوردن‎ (xordan), نوشیدن‎ (nušidan)
(idiomatic) to nourish a viper in one's bosom
to coagulate (as milk), to congeal, to clot
to rub, to massage, to smear

to remain, to stay, to hesitate, to survive, to endure, to last, to put, (with به‎) to resemble, to be like, to remind one of, عبیدزاکانی - بیا بریم دشت, خواب خرگوش به خواب یار می‌ماند بله, xấb-e xargúš be xấb-e yâr mí-mânad bále, Yes, the dream of the rabbit reminds me of the dream of my lover

to resemble, 6th A.H., Abul-Ma'ālī Nasrullāh-i Munšī, "Kabūtar-i Tawq-dār [کبوتر طوق‌دار]", Kalīla u Dimna., آورده‌اند که در ناحیت کشمیر متصیَّدی خوش و مرغزاری نزه بود که از عکس ریاحین او، پر زاغ چون دم طاووس نمودی و در پیش جمال او دم طاووس به پر زاغ مانستی.‎, Āwarda-and ki dar nāhiyat-i Kašmīr mutasayyadē xwaš u marğzārē nazih būd ki az aks-i rayāhīn-i ū, par-i zāğ čun dum-i tāwūs namūdē wa dar pēš-i jamāl-i ū, dum-i tāwūs ba par-i zāğ mānistê.
to be thankful, to be grateful
to interfere, to intrude, to meddle

to be thankful, to be grateful
to dispute, quarrel, سر کرایه با راننده‌ی تاکسی مناقشه کرد, sar-e kerāye bā rānande-ye tāksi monāqeše kard, He squabbled with the taxi driver over the fare.
to be waiting for, منتظر تو هستم.‎, Montazér-e to hastam. (more literary), منتظرتم.‎, Montazéretam. (most colloquial), I'm waiting for you.
to result, to finish, to terminate

column6: set

column3: (intransitive) to yell, shout (to make a loud sound with the voice, often out of anger, to tell someone off or to get attention), ‏به کسی نهیب زدن‎ ― be kasi nahib zadan ― to yell at someone, shout at someone

column3: to need, require, به کمکت نیاز دارم.‎, Be komaket niyâz dâram., I need your help.
(archaic or literary) to listen, (obsolete) to overhear
there is, there are, آب هست؟‎, Âb hast?, Is there water?, is
to leave, abandon, to let, allow, to put, place, deposit

column4: to let go, 1207-1273, Rumi, Fīhi Mā Fīh, "در بیان موانع غیبی", گفت: «مرا نمی‌هلند.» چون کار از حد گذشت، خواجه سر در مسجد کرد تا ببیند کیست که نمی‌هلد. جز کفشی و سایه‌ای کسی ندید و کس نمی‌جنبید. گفت: «آخر کیست که تو را نمی‌هلد که بیرون آیی؟»‎

column3: to cooperate, میل ندارند با یکدیگر همکاری کنند.‎, Meyl nádârand bâ yekdigar hamkârí kónand., They have no desire to cooperate with one another.
(Iran, colloquial) to plunder, (Iran, colloquial) to embezzle
(colloquial) to open, درو وا کن.‎, Dar-o vâ kon., Open the door.
to card (wool or cotton), to tease (separate the fibres), to separate
to set, appoint, to erect, to keep, prevent, to persuade
to enter, come in, arrive, ‏من دیروز به آمیرکا وارد شدم‎man diruz be âmrikâ vâred šodamI arrived in America yesterday, to be imported

(dialectal, Khesht, Konartakhteh, Dashtestan) to return, (dialectal, Khesht, Konartakhteh, Dashtestan) to come back
(obsolete) to grow, to wax(obsolete) to blaze
to exercise, to train, to cultivate
(obsolete) to dance, Synonym: رقصیدن‎ (raqsidan), (obsolete) to leap, Synonyms: جستن‎ (jastan), پریدن‎ (paridan)

to get older, to reach a certain age, to reach the age of..., برادر شبنم تازه پا به سن ۲۳ سالگی گذاشت.‎, Barâdar-e Šabnam tâze pâ be senn-e bist-o-se sâlegi gozâšt., Shabnam's brother recently turned 23.
(colloquial) to get up, ‏حسن پا شد و رفت‎Hasan got up and left
(intransitive, preceded by از‎) to guard (someone / something), (intransitive) to guard, stand guard, stand watch

to protect, guard, watch, to stand firm, wait, to be constant, steady, fixed, established, to subsist independently of anything, to fix the look steadily on any object, to trample upon, wear, beat, or make smooth with the feet, to kick, to wait, expect
to cook, to bake, to broil, to make ready, to ripen, to render well disposed towards, canvass for, gain for one's interests
to receive, to accept, to embrace
(transitive, causative) to cause to fly, Synonym: پر دادن‎ (par dâdan)

to ask, inquire, ‏از پدرم پرسیدم که آیا پشتو زبان سختی است یا نه.‎‎Az pedar-e man porsidam ke âyâ Pašto zabân-e moškeli ast yâ na. (more literary)(please add an English translation of this usage example)|I asked my father wether Pashto is difficult or not.}}, ‏از پدرم پرسیدم پشتو زبون سختیه یا نه.‎‎Az pedaram porsidam Pašto zabun-e moškeli-ye yâ na. (more colloquial)I asked my father whether Pashto is a difficult language or not., to question ^  Cheung, Johnny (2007) , “*fras/prs”, in Etymological Dictionary of the Iranian Verb (Leiden Indo-European Etymological Dictionary Series
to foster, to nourish, to preserve (to prepare food for storage)

(intransitive) to fly, Synonym: پرواز کردن‎ (parvâz kardan), (intransitive) to jump, ‏رنگ پریدن‎ ― rang paridan. ― to become very surprised, to become very sick. (literally, “for the color (of the face) to jump”), ‏از خواب پریدن‎ ― az xâb paridan. ― to wake up suddenly., Synonym: جستن‎ (jastan), (transitive, colloquial, Iran) to attack, to jump at someone, Synonyms: حمله کردن‎ (hamle kardan), تاختن‎ (tâxtan), (intransitive, rare) to evaporate, ‏الکل و بنزین می پرند.‎‎ ― alkol o benzin mi-parand. ― alcohol and benzene evaporate., Synonym: تبخیر شدن‎ (tabxir šodan)
to cover (place something over or upon, as to conceal or protect), to cover (costs), to cover (a story, event)
to wear, to cover ^  MacKenzie, D. N. (1971) , “pōšīdan”, in A concise Pahlavi dictionary, London, New York, Toronto: Oxford University Press, page 69, ,
to trot (walk rapidly), to search, examine
to examine, to investigate, to research
to adorn, decorate, ornament, embellish (especially by cutting, clipping, or taking away), to prune, clip, trim, to diminish, to tan
to come forward, (figurative) to come up, happen, ‏چه واقعه پیش آمده است؟‎‎če vaqe'e piš âmade ast?What has happened?
to suggest, to propose, to offer

column4: to roll up, (of travel) to turn, بپیچین به راست.‎, Bépičin be râst., Turn to the right.

column3: to be prosecutable, ‏استفاده نابجا از این دکمه اضطراری پیگرد قانونی دارد.‎‎Misuse of this Emergency Button is prosecutable.

(intransitive) to rotate, turn, revolve, spin (to move around an axis), ‏به دور خود چرخیدن‎ ― be dour-e xod čarxidan ― to turn, spin (around), ‏زمین به طور مداوم به دور خود می‌چرخد.‎‎ ― zamin be tur-e modâvem be dour-e xod mi-čarxad ― The Earth is constantly spinning., ‏زمین یک بار در هر بیست و چهار ساعت به دور خود می‌چرخد.‎‎ ― zamin yek bâr dar har bist-o-čahâr sâ’at be dour-e xod mi-čarxad ― The Earth revolves once every 24 hours., ‏به دور محور خود چرخیدن‎ ― be dour-e mehvar-e xod čarxidan ― to rotate about one’s axis, (intransitive) to spin (to rotate or turn around quickly), ‏توپ بر روی زمین به دور خود می‌چرخد.‎‎ ― tup bar ru-ye zamin be dour-e xod mi-čarxad ― The ball is spinning around on the ground., ‏آن اسکیت‌باز بر روی یخ به دور خود می‌چرخد.‎‎ ― ân eskeyt-bâz bar ru-ye yax be dour-e xod mi-čarxad ― That skater is spinning on the surface of the ice., (intransitive) to circle (to travel in a circle or circles), ‏پرنده‌ها بالای سرمان می‌چرخیدند.‎‎ ― parande-hâ bâlâ-ye saremân mi-čarxidand ― The birds were circling above us., (intransitive) to walk around, have a walk around, ‏رفتیم بیرون بچرخیم.‎‎ ― raftim birun be-čarxim ― We went out to walk around.
to stick, to glue, to paste
to stick, to glue, to paste
to stick, to be stuck, to adhere, to cling, to grasp
to strut, walk proudly, to flaunt
to gather, pile up, to layto pick, to pluck
(intransitive) to become disheveled, to become chaotic, to become messy
(archaic) to grumble, ‏او به خود می‌ژکید‎u be xod mi-žakidHe was grumbling to himself
to work, امروز هیچ کاری نمی‌کرده‌ام.‎, Emruz hič kâri nemi-kardám., I haven't done any work today., to function, رایانم کار نمی‌کنه.‎, Râyânám kâr némi-kone., My computer doesn't work.
to sow, to plant, to grow (transitive)

(intransitive) to rotate, turn, revolve, spin (to move around an axis), ‏زمین به طور مداوم به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎ ― zamin be tur-e modâvem be dour-e xod mi-gardad ― The Earth is constantly spinning., ‏زمین یک بار در هر بیست و چهار ساعت به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎ ― zamin yek bâr dar har bist-o-čahâr sâ’at be dour-e xod mi-gardad ― The Earth revolves once every 24 hours., (intransitive) to spin (to rotate or turn around quickly), ‏توپ بر روی زمین به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎ ― tup bar ru-ye zamin be dour-e xod mi-gardad ― The ball is spinning on the ground., (intransitive) to circulate (to move in a circuit, for example blood, air), ‏هوا در فضای خانه می‌گردد.‎‎ ― havâ dar fazâ-ye xâne mi-gardad ― The air is circulating around the house (space)., (intransitive) to circle (to travel in a circle or circles), ‏پرنده‌ها بالای سرمان می‌گردند.‎‎ ― parande-hâ bâlâ-ye saremân mi-gardand ― The birds are circling above us., (intransitive) to walk around, have a walk around

(transitive, literary) to bite, Synonym: گاز گرفتن‎ (gâz gereftan), (transitive) to sting, Synonym: نیش زدن‎ (niš zadan)(transitive) to choose, Synonym: انتخاب کردن‎ (entexâb kardan), (transitive, archaic) to prefer, Synonym: ترجیح دادن‎ (tarjih dâdan)
(archaic) Alternative form of گشودن‎, to open, Synonym: باز کردن‎ (bâz kardan)

(intransitive) to rotate, turn, revolve, spin (to move around an axis), Synonyms: چرخیدن‎ (čarxidan), گردیدن‎ (gardidan), ‏به دور خود گشتن‎be dour-e xod gaštanto turn, spin (around), ‏زمین به طور مداوم به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎zamin be tur-e modâvem be dour-e xod mi-gardadThe Earth is constantly spinning., ‏زمین یک بار در هر بیست و چهار ساعت به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎zamin yek bâr dar har bist-o-čahâr sâ’at be dour-e xod mi-gardadThe Earth revolves once every 24 hours., (intransitive) to spin (to rotate or turn around quickly), Synonyms: چرخیدن‎ (čarxidan), گردیدن‎ (gardidan), ‏توپ بر روی زمین به دور خود می‌گردد.‎‎tup bar ru-ye zamin be dour-e xod mi-gardadThe ball is spinning on the ground., (intransitive) to circulate (to move in a circuit, for example blood, air), Synonyms: گردیدن‎ (gardidan), در گردش بودن‎ (dar gardeš budan), ‏هوا در فضای خانه می‌گردد.‎‎ ― havâ dar fazâ-ye xâne mi-gardad ― The air is circulating around the house (space)., (intransitive) to circle (to travel in a circle or circles), Synonyms: چرخیدن‎ (čarxidan), گردیدن‎ (gardidan), ‏پرنده‌ها بالای سرمان می‌گشتند.‎‎ ― parande-hâ bâlâ-ye saremân mi-gaštand ― The birds were circling above us., (intransitive) to walk around, have a walk around, Synonyms: چرخیدن‎ (čarxidan), گردیدن‎ (gardidan), ‏بیا برویم بگردیم.‎‎ ― biyâ be-ravim be-gardim ― Let’s go walk around., ‏رفتیم بیرون بگردیم.‎‎ ― raftim birun be-gardim ― We went out to walk around., to become, to be changed

(archaic) to open, Synonym: باز کردن‎ (bâz kardan), به گفتهٔ وزیر دادگستری ترکیه یکی از مهاجمان با کلاشنیکف به روی مردم آتش گشود.‎, Be gofte-ye vazir-e dâdgostari-e Torkiye yeki az mohâjemân bâ kalâšnikof be ru-ye mardom âtaš gošud., According to the Turkish Minister of Justice one of the attackers opened fire on people with a Kalashnikov.
(rare) third-person singular past of گفتن‎, (rare) answered, Hafez, گفتم غمِ تو دارم، گفتا غمت سرآید -- گفتم که ماه من شو، گفتا اگر برآید

to lose, especially through obliviousness, فکر می‌کنم که برادرت کتابم و گم کرد.‎, fekr mikonam ke barâdaret ketâbam-o gom kard. (colloquial), I think your brother lost my book.
to rot, decay, go bad, spoil, to stagnate (of water, air, etc)
Alternative form of گواشتن‎, to digest
Alternative form of گواشتن‎, to digest
to grow, to increase, to sprout
to listen, ‏آهنگ‌ها رو گوش دادی؟‎‎Âhang-hâ ro guš dâdi?Did you listen to the songs?, ‏چرا بهم گوش نمی‌دی؟‎‎Čerâ behem guš nemi-di?Why aren't you listening to me?
to listen, آهنگ‌ها رو گوش کردی؟‎, Âhang-hâ ro guš kardi?, Did you listen to the songs?, چرا بهم گوش نمی‌کنی؟‎, Čerâ behem guš nemi-koni?, Why aren't you listening to me?
to deceive, to dupe, to fool, to trick, ‏بچه‌ها اورا گول زدند‎The children fooled him.
to teach, میا به آنها یک بازی یاد داد, Mia beh ânhâ yek bâzi yâd dâd., Mia taught them a game.

to forget, یادت نره به مادرت تلفن کنی.‎, Yấdet náre be mâdáret telefón kóni., Don't forget to call your mother., یادم رفت کتاب‌هات رو بخرم.‎, Yấdam raft ketâbất ro béxaram., I forgot to buy your books.
(archaic) to be able to, Synonym: توانستن‎ (tavânestan), to dare, (archaic) Synonym: جرأت داشتن‎ (jor’at dâštan)
(transitive, obsolete) to attain, to reach or come to, (intransitive, obsolete) to attain, to come or arrive

to acquire, find, ‏آخر چگونه میتوان راه‌حل مناسبی برای چنین مشکل بغرنجی یافت!‎‎âxar cegune mitavân râh-e hall-e monâseb-i barâ-ye cenin moškel-e boqranj-i yâft!But how is one to find a suitable solution for such an intractable problem!
to be sure, to be certain, یقین ندارم که با ما بیان.‎, Yaqin nadâram ke bâ mâ biân., I'm not sure that they are coming with us.

Alamut (castle), 1340, Hamdallah-i Mustawfī, Nuzhat-ul-Qulūb, ‏و معتبرترین همه قلعهٔ الموت که دارالملک اسمعیلیان ایران زمین بود و صد و هفتاد و یک سال مقر دولت ایشان بود و آن قلعه از اقلیم چهارم است.‎‎wa mu'tabar-tarīn-i hama, qal'a-i Alamūt, ki dār-ul-mulk-i Ismā'īliyān-i Ērān-zamīn būd u sad-u-haftād-u-yak sāl maqarr-i dawlat-i ēšān būd, wa ān qal'a az iqlīm-i čahārum ast.[...] and the most authoritative of all [of the castles in Rudbar]—the Alamut Castle, which was the capital of the [Nizari] Isma'ilis of Greater Iran, and for one hundred and seventy-one years was the headquarters of their state. The castle is in the Fourth Province., Alamut (region)

And this river is called "sinful" because it is flowing toward Rome [Byzantine Empire], that is to say, since it is going from the lands of Islam to the lands of kufr, it is "sinful", and over [the] river they have built many Persian wheels.

(archaic) Frank, French, (archaic) crusader, 1184–1291, Saadi, Golestan, ‏از صحبت یاران دمشقم ملالتی پدید آمده بود، سر در بیابان قدس نهادم و با حیوانات انس گرفتم تا وقتی که اسیر قید فرنگ شدم و در خندق طرابلس با جهودانم به کارگل داشتند.‎‎az suhbat-i yārān-i Damišqam malālati padīd āmada būd, sar dar biyābān-i Quds nahādam u bā haywānāt uns giriftam tā waqtī ki asīr-i qayd-i Farang šudam u dar xandaq-i Tarābulus bā Jahūdānam ba kārgil dāštand.I was upset from my Damascene friends and went to the desert of Palestine (...), until I was taken as captive by the Franks/Crusaders and they sent me with Jews as forced labourers to Tripoli, [Lebanon]., (archaic) European, (archaic) Christian, 1141–1209, Nezami, ‏فرنگ فلسطین و رهبان روم  پذیرای فرمان مهرش چو موم‎Farang-i Filistīn u rahbān-i Rōm  paḏīrā-yi farmān-i mihraš ču mōm(please add an English translation of this usage example)(archaic) Francia, 1045–1052, Nasir Khusraw, Safarnama, ‏باجگاهی است آن جا که کشتی های که از اطراف روم و فرنگ و اندلس و مغرب بیاید عشر به سلطان دهند‎bājgāhē ast ānjā ki kaštī-hā'ē ki az atrāf-i Rōm u Farang u Andalus u Mağrib biyāyand ušr ba sultān dahand.... there is a place to collect tribute over there through which the ships that come from Rum [Anatolia], Francia, Al-Andalus, and Maghreb pay ushr [one-tenth of the earned profit] to the sultan ..., (dated) France, (dated) Western world, especially Europe

Nowruz, New Year in the Iranian and Zoroastrian calendar, celebrated on the spring equinox., 940-1020, Ferdowsi, Shahnameh, "پادشاهی بهرام گور", ‏چو شد ساخته کار آتشکده  همان جای نوروز و جشن سده  بیامد سوی آذرآبادگان  خود و نامداران و آزادگان‎ču šud sāxta kār-i Ātaškada  hamān jāy-i Nawrōz u jašn-i Sada  biyāmad sōy-i Āḏarābādagān  xwad u nāmdārān u āzādagān(please add an English translation of this quote), 1048-1131, Omar Khayyám, Rubaiyat, ruba'i #19, ‏بر چهرهٔ گل نسیم نوروز خوش است  در صحن چمن روی دل‌افروز خوش است  از دی که گذشت هر چه گویی خوش نیست  خوش باش و ز دی مگو که امروز خوش است‎bar čihra-i gul nasīm-i Nawrōz xwaš ast  dar sahn-i čaman rōy-i dil-afrōz xwaš ast  az dī ki guḏašt har či gōyī xwaš nēst  xwaš bāš u zi dī ma-gō ki imrōz xvaš ast(please add an English translation of this quote), 1184-1291, Saadi Shirazi, Divan, ghazal #112, ‏نظر به روی تو هر بامداد نوروزیست  شب فراق تو هر شب که هست یلداییست‎nazar ba rōy-i tu har bāmdād Nawrōzēst  šab-i firāq-i tu har šab ki hast Yaldāēst(please add an English translation of this quote), 1207-1273, Rumi, Divan-e Shams, tarji' #7, ‏مستی و عاشقی و جوانی و یار ما  نوروز و نوبهار و حمل می‌زند صلا  هرگز ندیده چشم جهان این چنین بهار  می‌روید از زمین و ز کهسار کیمیا‎mastī u āšiqī u jawānī u yār-i mā  Nawrōz u nawbahār u Hamal mē-zanad salā  hargiz nadīda čašm-i jahān īn čunīn bahār  mē-rōyad az zamīn u zi kuhsār kīmiyā(please add an English translation of this quote)

Yalda, an Iranian festival celebrated during the longest and darkest night of the year (i.e. winter solstice)[3]1184-1291, Saadi Shirazi, Divan, ghazal #112, نظر به روی تو هر بامداد نوروزیست  شب فراق تو هر شب که هست یلداییست, nazar ba rōy-i tu har bāmdād Naurōzēst  šab-i firāq-i tu har šab ki hast Yaldāēst, A female given name, Yalda. ^  Āryān, Qamar. (1999). "Christianity VI: In Persian Literature." Encyclopedia Iranica, vol. 5, f5. Costa Mesa: Mazda Publishers. pp. 539-542.[p. 541] "Persian or persianized forms in the second category [i.e. 'words and phrases that entered Persian ... as a result of contacts with Christian communities in Persia'] are fewer, for example, [...] yaldā (winter solstice, i.e., Christmas).", ,  ^  Dehkhoda, Ali Akbar
column4: et al. (1995). "یلدا". Loghat Nāmeh Dehkhodā: The Encyclopaedic Dictionary of the Persian Language. Costa Mesa: Mazda Publishers."[...] Syriac word for Noel [...]", , ↑ 3.0 3.1 Krasnowolska, Anna. (2009). "Sada Festival." Encyclopedia Iranica, online edition. New York: iranicaonline.org.[par. 8] "In Islamic Persia, the night of the winter solstice (the last night of autumn) was known under its Syriac name of Šab-e Yaldā (the night of nativity) [...]. Being the longest and the darkest night of the year, additionally connected with Christianity, Šab-e Yaldā usually has negative connotations in Persian poetry ([...])"[par. 7] "Yet, the authors, who reported on the fire festivals [call them X, Y and Z] interchangeably, thus identifying Sada with the Christian holiday of the Christmas which approximately falls on the winter solstice.", ,  ^  Krasnowolska, Anna. (1999). "Šab-e Čella." Folia Orientalia 35. pp. 55-74.[p. 56] "in multicultural areas of the Middle East, Christmas (Syr. Yaldā- "Nativity") was celebrated by local Christians. The festival's name (maybe with some elements of its rite) passed to their non-Christian neighbours".[p. 59] "The Syriac term yaldā, adopted in Persian for the longest night of the year, [...]", ,

(more literary)#since#‏از کی تا حالا؟‎‎ ― Az kéy tâ hâlâ? ― Since when?#than#‏این کتاب از آن کتاب بهتر است.‎‎In ketâb az ân ketâb behtar ast.This book is better than that one. (more literary)#‏این کتاب از اون کتاب بهتره.‎‎In ketâb az un ketâb behtar-e.This book is better than that one. (more colloquial)#ofUsage notesEdit#In standard and colloquial modern Persian (more so in colloquial Persian), the preposition is used with an enclitic pronoun when a pronoun is the object of the sentence. For instance, the phrase “از او پرسیدم” (az u porsidam, lit. “from him (I) asked”) becomes “ازش پرسیدم” (az-aš porsidam) when using the enclitic third-person singular pronoun.#

(anatomy) back, rear, behind, (archaic) catamite, generation, descentbehind, وی پشت درخت پنهان می‌شود.‎, Vey pošt-e deraxt panhân mi-šavad. (more literary), او پشت درخت پنهون می‌شه.‎, U pošt-e deraxt penhun mi-še. (more colloquial), He/she is hiding behind the tree.
(anatomy, dialectal, Isfahan) back, (dialectal, Isfahan) rear, (dialectal, Isfahan) behind(dialectal, Isfahan) behind
(âyâ)#initial interrogative particleUsage notesEdit#Used only in written Persian

(râ)#indicates that the preceding noun phrase is a definite direct object#‏دیروز او را دیدم.‎‎Diruz u râ didam.I saw him yesterday.#‏باید تو را پیدا کنم.‎‎Bâyad to râ peydâ konam.I have to find you.#(often dated) to
column4: indicates that the preceding noun phrase is an indirect object#‏خدا را شكر.‎‎Xodâ râ šokr.Thank God.(literally, “Thanks [be] to God.”)#(archaic) for the sake ofUsage notesEdit#را‎ (râ) follows the direct object only if the referent has already been identified or is immediately identifiable. In English, this will usually correspond to a personal pronoun, a proper noun, or a common noun preceded by the definite article (the), a demonstrative determiner, or a possessive determiner.

column3: (ro)#(colloquial, Iran, Iranian Persian) Colloquial Iranian form of را‎ (râ)
wet and sticky, clammy(archaic, poetic) pine tree(informal) Alternative form of نچ‎
(-o)#(colloquial, Iranian Persian, Iran) Shortened form of رو‎ (ro)
column4: both are spoken forms of را‎ (râ).#دستت‍‍و بلند کن.‎#Dasteto boland kon.#Raise your hand.
see Appendix:Persian ezâfeUsage notesEdit#Used after words ending in the vowels ـه‎ (-e), ـا‎ (-â), or ـو‎ (-u, -o).#
